website_summaries.verdict: The Fitbit Charge 4 boasts some great new features, especially personalised Active Zone Minutes - a new motivational fitness metric to aim for. It’s our new favourite all-round Fitbit tracker and it bests even the Versa 2 smartwatch with its built-in GPS.

customer_reviews.title: MASSIVELY dissappointed by the battery life.
customer_reviews.text: A single 10k run (c. 1 hour 20 minutes, incl. warm up and cool down) took the battery from 60% to 9% Absolutely no chance of using this to track a half marathon, then... Update:. Battery life seems to have become a bit better after a firmware update. However, it's the distance tracking that's now making it unusable. It's widely optimistic, with every run coming in 15-20% over the actual distance, checked against maps and Strava!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these, they haven't been tested and aren't robust...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first FitBit and at first, the screen wouldn't respond so couldn't be connected. I left it for a day and hey presto, it came to life. However, the strap then broke and it fell off my wrist whilst cycling and was smashed. So, I order a new one and same again, the screen won't respond so can't be paired. Maybe I'll leave it another day again. Either way, they just haven't been tested properly and aren't robust if they won't stay on your wrist!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Craig Taylor

customer_reviews.title: No Spotify but good upgrade to charge 2
customer_reviews.text: Really great upgrade to now have GPS and warerproof but very annoyed that it’s mis sold as it doesn’t yet have Spotify which is essentially false advertising, will be reporting this.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Davie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My Charge 3 left me stranded so I thought to choose the upgrade. Not what I was expecting. I put it in the dock, seemed to work. Once unplugged and connected, the device died. I tried to charge it again, no response. Gave it a few hours before returning it. I guess it is a new product and that these are teething problems or perhaps I had particularly bad luck. Got another Charge 3 for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: iaietta

customer_reviews.title: Payment option
customer_reviews.text: Great product, please note the payment option on Fitbit is limeted to very few banks in the UK. I would advise checking the list of banks it support, if it something you really want.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Angelo Bonandi

customer_reviews.title: the perfect Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: II have bought this for my partner and she couldn't be more excited. with the integrated GPS when you go for a run or any other activities there is no more need to carry your smartphone with you. The free FITBIT app is really user friendly and exhaustive at the same time as many different stats are provided (heart rate beat, sleep quality, calories burnt, oxygen levels etc...) Last but not least, the watch design is really cool and it also not too big and heavy. Thanks FITBIT!
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 days from one battery charge
customer_reviews.text: Had it 4 days. I use it for mountain biking and walking. Dissapointed with the battery I'm getting 1.5 days on a single charge ran out today mid ride. Besides that I'm happy with all the features.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey m Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you want to track your exercise
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this until they've fixed the GPS issue. The device can't find a GPS signal even when outside with clear skies and unlike the rest of the Fitbit range it doesn't have connected GPS so you have to use your phone as a tracker and then nothing shows on your device. Basically rendering it pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Moncrieff

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with the Charge 4 since receiving it last week. The notifications stop syncing from phone constantly, had to go through a painful update to get some of the promised features, I can't access the fitbit coach app making the workout feature on app pointless and now my steps haven't reset on my tracker despite a full reset and re-pair to phone. Really disappointed and wish I'd gone for a different fitness tracker. I've also contacted the support team but had no response.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Mansell

customer_reviews.title: Caloric burn is very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: 7274 calories is the max I've burned in a single day according to this. I think it's safe to say I've not even come remotely close to that. The steps counter is also not the greatest as a simple act of raising my hand adds to the steps quite often as well. Everything else works fine but these 2 features (the main reason I bought the device) have rendered it almost useless for me as I'm not getting the correct data. Will be returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rhod

customer_reviews.title: OK - not worth an upgrade from Charge 3
customer_reviews.text: Not worth an upgrade from Charge 3. Only have a choice of two colours - black and rosewood (dark plum) - an option to have a silver and/or gold choice would be nice. It's still very hard to see the screen in bright sunlight and if using the GPS to track exercise this will drain the battery so will only last a day or so. Sadly you can't opt to turn the GPS 'off' on the watch and use your phone's but this is apparently being looked at by Fitbit but don't expect a quick fix. It's a shame the screen is still monochrome - it would be so much better with a colour screen.
customer_reviews.author: chn23

customer_reviews.title: GPS won't work, Doesn't record when doing weights
customer_reviews.text: If you bought like me to do a variety of exercises. Don't. It doesn't work when doing weights, something to do with it moving from your wrist, meaning it doesn't accurately measure your heart. Happens with both mine and my other half when we do any sort of exercise that isn't running. The GPS also doesn't work if you don't take your phone with you, or you're battery isn't above 80% - which it is for about 10 mins after charging. All in all, it's a glorified pedometer on an App that measures how you sleep. Get a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life, GPS signal takes forever to find if at all
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a charge 3 as I wanted the integrated GPS so I didn't have to link to my phone. Unfortunately the GPS took forever to find and connect, added to this the battery went from fully charged to low when out for a ride. It's advertised as 7 day battery life but I got 1 day; hardly an upgrade from the charge 3.
customer_reviews.author: John Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery and controls are irritating
customer_reviews.text: Although the main functions work, GPS, heart rate monitoring, step tracking etc. The battery life when using GPS, main reason we upgraded from a previous version, is absolutely woeful! Unless you are doing a 20 - 30 minute activity, you might as well leave the fitbit at home because it will die on you halfway through the ride or walk etc. If the battery doesn't die before you finish, you may wish it had when you try and stop the activity tracking using the swipe controls! Sinking with the phone is the next fun part, as it often requires the phone to be restarted before the fitbit will reconnect and sink? Overall its more trouble than its worth!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not work
customer_reviews.text: Having had a Charge 2 for a few years it is reluctant to charge so I decided to upgrade to the Charge 4. Unfortunately it would not pair with either my phone or my new Ipad. Amazon help desk were extremely helpful but despite trying everything possible it would still not pair. I was then transferred to Fitbit in the US who inferred it was my fault it would not pair and suggested I go out and borrow someone else's phone to try! I had no alternative to return the Charge 4 to Amazon which hasn't resolved my problem. Upon checking on the Fitbit website this would appear to be a known problem with lots of comments and no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: mw8811

customer_reviews.title: Tracks most aspects of fitness
customer_reviews.text: My third fitbit and the best to date. Getting used to the controls is a little difficult as they are a little fiddly for large fingers, but once mastered all works well. The GPS function is good, route tracking, heart rate on route, speed on route is good for the stats geek. Sleep tracking is I think a little hit and miss, but generally ok. A good investment for those who get out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Charge 2
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a charge 2 and it is considerably better and more accurate. It’s also lighter and more comfortable to wear. With hindsight, I could have gone for the cheaper charge 3, because there is little difference and the GPS tracker which influenced my choice seriously drains the battery. Battery life isn’t 7 days as claimed either. Overall though, I’m delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: JHO

customer_reviews.title: Looks very useful but I don't like the feeling of plastic on my skin.
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit charge 4 has a basic yet effective user interface and a mature, user friendly mobile app (tested on Android). The sensors appear to be working. However, the device itself and the standard bands that came with it are made of plastic and they feel cheap. Haven't tried the leather band but I think it's too expensive for a band. I purchased the device to get a log of my heart rate and sleep over a period of a month; I think this is what fitbit is good for, but I don't think I'll be using it as a watch after that. I simply don't link the feel of plastic on my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Nikos

customer_reviews.title: You may be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product proved to be a major disappointment from the start. Unpacked it , put it on charge, and nothing happened. No display on sceeen. Bluetooth switched on and off as mentioned on Fitbit app for setting up. Tried restarting device by pressing button for 10secs....no difference. Left it on charge for an hour, no change. Tried suggested options again without success. Meanwhile my low cost option still reconnected and carried on tracking. So device went back in its box to be returned. Not risking another one now, so refund awaits.
customer_reviews.author: Hypnoman

customer_reviews.title: Light and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great little tracker, hardly notice your wearing it .. comes with two straps so from my wife's thin little wrists upto my chunky wrists are accommodated 👍😁 The GPS is accurate but does eat your battery.. when I'm walking the dogs I don't take my phone ..so when I get home it connects and syncs while I take my boots off ...it's been great over the last month or so..battery life is very good haven't got 7 days out of it, but it's alot better than my old tracker... the display set to auto is visible in all brightnessess .. It's a great price too
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Decent smart watch for price point
customer_reviews.text: Good watch, does what it says on the box and does it well considering price point. Seems odd that certain features within the mobile app require significant and continuing further expenditure in the form of a subscription, such as sleep insights, access to which is somewhat superfluous and definitely overpriced - nonetheless the basic app is more than sufficient and the watch fairly accurate and is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Maglieri

customer_reviews.title: Simply unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: It is disappointing that Fitbit should release a product with so many issues. Just try looking up “Fitbit charge 4 stuck on setup screen”, and you will see the unnecessary drama associated with this product. After spending numerous hours on the Fitbit Support Forum, syncing/un-syncing the device, pairing/un-pairing Bluetooth and rebooting everything in sight, it is time to send the product back to the retailer. The Fitbit help Forums suggest this is some sort of “known issue” that will be “resolved with a firmware upgrade” that “should arrive within 48 hours automatically if you leave it plugged in to a power supply”. Well I’ve had a week of this, and my patience has finally ended.
customer_reviews.author: DaveN...

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life states up to 7 days reality states every two days this is completely out of battery either it’s faulty or they are telling lies
customer_reviews.author: Lisa-Marie Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this watch is not capable of backing up its software capabilities. No Spotify yet although the product discretion said it can use it. Very few banks connected. Cheap looking black plastic shell. Apart from GPS it's basically a charge 3 with a cheap looking shell. I returned mine as I felt the product description was false
customer_reviews.author: Chuck eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Basically just a charge 3 with GPS
customer_reviews.text: I got it for the GPS tracking for running but I'm having to return it because it's just not good enough. It really struggles to connect and if it does connect it is very inaccurate. It reported a run as 600m further than it really was and that was just a 5k run so the stats were ruined. The spotify feature doesn't actually do anything, it's just a way to control your phone so you still have to carry a phone. If I'm carrying a phone I might as well just track the run with it, it's far more accurate than this device is.
customer_reviews.author: DarkLegacy

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing ,The battery life lasts less than 1 day despite being brand new as I’ve only just bought it , the charger is very sensitive and doesn’t always charge despite being clicked into place as per instructions & when you press the side button to light up the screen it doesn’t always work , also when you swipe across to exercise function that also doesn’t work first time and can take take several swipes to get it to work which is frustrating for the money it costs 😌
customer_reviews.author: natasha morrell

customer_reviews.title: Very good, whilst slightly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the Fitbit a lot, my main issues are: 1. It says it automatically recognises when I cycle, it doesn’t 2. It only counts roughly 3/4 times when I go up stairs 3. I do a lot of circuit training, which it sometimes mistakes for sport, which it ‘auto recognises’ and then inaccurately logs my workout when it syncs with my phone Other than that, it’s a great piece of equipment. I love the food log, the sleep analysis, weekly reports etc
customer_reviews.author: Negrology

customer_reviews.title: Considering a return due to poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: The device is great, the app is brilliant. But the battery isn't fit for purpose. With the GPS on, and moderate exercise (two 2 mile walks), it lost ~80% charge in 24 hours. Going to charge it up to full again and run with the GPS disabled. But if it barely lasts a day and a half with moderate exercise, then I think i'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Falmouth88

customer_reviews.title: GPS
customer_reviews.text: GPS kills the battery in minutes, the device is useless as a tracker. I definitely will return it and back to my Charge 2 that never disappoints me so much.
customer_reviews.author: Diall

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitbit for owners of Fitbit charge 2 and 3
customer_reviews.text: I own fitbit charge 4 for 2 days and I love it it have more features then fitbit charge 3 and I had fitbit charge 2 previously it be my backup to fitbit charge 4 I do like zone training its ideal for working at home during covid 19. If you ever own Fitbit before you should buy Fitbit charge 4 as your first can't go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carter

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this I did not look into everything it did. It was mainly to record my fitness walks. However, the sleep patterns, heart rate, fat burning zones, options to record food and water intake are brilliant. Who knew I was not sleeping so well some nights, brilliant to know my heart rate is healthy and consistent. The added bonus of being waterproof and also the battery lasts around 5 days I am NEVER going to be without a fitbit again!! BOOM.
customer_reviews.author: Saztanion

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing upgrade from charge 2 🙁
customer_reviews.text: Debated and compared loads of activity trackers before deciding to upgrade my charge 2 to the charge 4. I had been using the charge 2 daily for 3 years so had big hopes for the charge 4. I have had the charge 4 for about a month now and have been wearing it daily. Pro’s: it is a nice fit on my wrist. Heart rate seems more accurate than the charge 2. Cons: activity minutes are now zone minutes. Zone minutes don’t seem to be logical. Walking or other daily exercise doesn’t always track which is really annoying when my main reason for using it is to keep me motivated.
customer_reviews.author: Russpeth

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, it is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Key points: 1. Touchscreen very unresponsive, lagging and takes several swipes to pick up the motion. 2. The GPS is very inaccurate. 3. Cannot use majority of "clock faces" for some reason. 4. To get any usefulness from the watch you have to pay a monthly subscription fee of Fitbit premium.
customer_reviews.author: Darius

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way of getting GPS but screen unreadable on the move.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the item as I wanted a cheap way of getting GPS tracking for cycling and hiking. Performs quite well but not having auto pause and the watch making the wrong decisions about stopping and restating exercise is a disappointment. Heart rate monitoring agrees with a Polar product so seems to be accurate. Screen is the biggest let down. Only displays for 4 seconds with no option for a longer time period. I now regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ross C Browning

customer_reviews.title: Steps reading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my wife who had the charge 3 which was getting old. One thing my wife commented on is the battery seems to need charging more often and the steps reading is not a default and need selecting from the range of displays offered. the only thing is it keeps defaulting back to the original display and needs to be set again to show steps. But despite these little niggles it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Initially proved to be a great purchase. After a week it started to freeze and show wildly inaccurate data when compared to a device with a proven track record. This is my 2nd Fitbit product which hasn't lived up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Lees

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit charge 4. Faulty
customer_reviews.text: The screen stays blank but still vibrates, there’s absolutely no recognition of charging and if it wasn’t for vibrating I wouldn’t even know it had power. Screen doesn’t light up or show anything at all, Not possible to sync or set up through app because it’s not turning on. Followed the troubleshooting steps and forced reboot does nothing. Spent hours charging and rebooting still nothing. Lots of people experiencing this on the Fitbit forums.
customer_reviews.author: kay bowes

customer_reviews.title: Its alright but not the best
customer_reviews.text: When i first got this it was a pain in the butt to charge up - you need to keep it plugged in until you see the wee smiley face and although they said it lasts for up to 7 days without charging the battery, it actually only lasts for about 2ish maybe 3 days on a full charge... which is crap as they said it would last for 7 days.. lol As for the mobile app its ok but isnt very accurate as the step counter counts steps when you are sleeping lol..?? overall il give this a 3 star.. it could of been a 5 if the battery would actually keep its charge though.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitbit and good value
customer_reviews.text: Love this Fitbit. Better than my previous Fitbit alto but without the hefty price tag of the bigger more technical ones. Does everything I need and more. Even my techy son was impressed with it for the money. Great product
customer_reviews.author: ceri

customer_reviews.title: Does everything you need it to and well - looks great too!
customer_reviews.text: Just a quick review as this is my wife's watch (birthday present). She's really pleased with the FitBit. It monitors sleep, work, exercise, heart rate and puts it all together in a great app. As the day goes by she'll get loads of achievements from the app for things like walking up stairs, beating her step target, etc. The addition of the GPS is well worth the extra as it tracks overall distances as well as elevation so you know how high you've climbed during the day. Overall a great buy (I've asked Santa for one!)
customer_reviews.author: Bob Grant

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even use this item, as soon as I took it from the box, compared to my Charge 2, it felt flimsy and poor quality where the straps attach to tracker. They were loose and moved a lot! I really like Fitbit but this one has really disappointed me! Might be time to find a different brand tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Em-j

customer_reviews.title: Babttery Life up to Seven Days. Well......
customer_reviews.text: I got my first Fitbit watch, the Blaze, for my 70th birthday December 2016. I git two years out it before the battery needed charging every other day. My second Blaze lasted 18 months before I had to replace it.. I now have the Charge 4. I walk/run/cycle over 100k per week. I use the GPS which is pretty accurate, but I have to charge the battery twice per week, so I don’t know how little I have to do to get the battery Battery to last 7 days. Other than I’m okay with it. Maybe I should upgrade to a better watch.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my hubby and he loves it totally. He says it's brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for hubby and he loves it. He's of the older generation in his 70's but he loves it and uses it literally daily with exercise. He says it's simple to use, easy to understand and gives him all the information he needs daily. Plus he can wear it in the shower and the charge lasts for days and days on end. It's also easy to charge and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: RWheeler

customer_reviews.title: Screen worked for 3 seconds then died. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.text: I got a FItbit Charge 4 (my wife has a Charge 3 that's she's perfectly happy with) and plugged it in the charging cradle, the screen came on for 3 seconds then never worked again. I spent 30 mins on the phone with technical support who concluded it was D.O.A. and should be returned. Giving 2 stars (rather than 1) because it was easy to get through to support and the young woman on the phone was very helpful and apologetic. I may buy a Charge 3 instead as, based on the Amazon reviews, I'm not the only person who's had a bad experience with the Charge 4 build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not 100%
customer_reviews.text: Good for getting started but would want to invest a bit more next time as there are limitations - the app is great and free premium trial a big bonus. The watch doesn't have a button to track indoor workouts though and with GPS off on it doesn't record brilliantly for runs (my GPS was off to save battery as I ran with a friend, hers recorded average rate of 5.47 and mine said 6.39, we ran together the whole time)
customer_reviews.author: Emily Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit are of little help had problems tracking sleep this Fitbit did advise that this feature had been turned off calories stored for custom food will not load onto daily total . Battery life is very short if you have the sat nav sleep and Bluetooth turned on Only way to get anything like the stated battery life is just use it as a watch and turn off all the other features Not recommended I previously had a Fitbit Charge 3 which worked perfectly prompting me to upgrade to Charge 4 A big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good but new features not that great
customer_reviews.text: I had the charge 2 and I wanted an upgrade. The thing I love the most about fitibit is the app really. The spotify wasn't that handy and the fitbit pay includes only certain banks in the UK and not mine. Smartwatch is really nice though. Would recommend but don't get your hopes up for the spotify and fitbit pay action. Check your bank in advance if that feature matters a lot to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is not an advance on previous models.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a step back from previous models. It shuts down suddenly when still showing 10% battery. It has a shorter battery life. It is supposed to be used as a payment method but does not support most banking cards. I have no idea how one accesses the gps for anything useful. The screen is not bright and difficult to read. The app is clunky and accuracy is poor. I have recorded a spread of over 1000 paces on an identical run. Would not recommend but if pushed would go for Charge 2.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Robson

customer_reviews.title: Did not turn on
customer_reviews.text: After following the instructions and putting it on charge the device turned on, I left it to charge for a bit and then tried to use it however it was not responding and nothing was displayed on the screen, left it for a bit longer and still not working. I returned and had no issues with returning and refund.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Pepper

customer_reviews.title: The Fitbit Charge4
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Charge4 is a useful device for monitoring one’s fitness and it includes a heart rate monitor, a gps for measuring distance covered, a step counter and even a means of recording sleep quality and duration. I think it works very well, but I can’t replicate the manufacturer’s claims for battery life between charges. I get around four days, rather than the seven that they say, but it’s not really a big issue. It’s a good device and simple enough to use.
customer_reviews.author: moonraker

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit 4
customer_reviews.text: I like some of the apps for example sleep tracking, heart, etc. I don’t like the sync as it keeps failing and I have to keep reconnecting so very disappointing as I have had other fitbits and been 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Always a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: My Fitbit Surge of 6 years is still working but the strap needs to be changed for the second time, so I decided it's time to upgrade. I luv my Surge though not as updated as the newer models, it tracks my climbs during hikes and other usuals. This new Charge 4 is just as good, and extra includes constant reminder to exercise and with GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GPS reliability is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Apart from widely reported battery drainage issues, I have found that the GPS only remains connected on about 40% of runs, even with an almost full battery. Unless there are no clouds, no trees and no hills, it is unusable. As I upgraded to the Charge 4 specifically for the GPS benefits ('leave your phone at home' they said) I am going to send it back and buy a different GPS tracker.
customer_reviews.author: P. D. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Clearly it's been rushed to production. It's glitchy and needs resetting constantly, it needs multiple updates in the first few days. You can't use the spotify controls to begin with, it needs the update first. The pay function is pointless as it's not compatible with many of the main stream banks. Battery is pretty much flat after tracking one decent run or cycle. I'll be instigating a return for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Returned after a week as it was difficult to sync with the app, change the screen and other functions. The big issue is the app which isn’t set up properly to support the functions of the watch. It was very frustrating. They should invest more money on the app development as I think the watch itself wasn’t that bad.
customer_reviews.author: marianna

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good device but has a known fault
customer_reviews.text: This seems like an awesome device for the money but it comes with a known fault. The strap doesnt actually fit correctly onto the device. There is a small gap at either side which just collects dirt. after a day with the device I looked up about this and so many people have the same issue. It seems to be a common fault with version 4 of the fitbit charge. I have returned this for now. I may buy again in the future once this fault has been rectified.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: battery charge is 7 days w/o gps and 5 hours with  except it doesn't come anywhere near this.
customer_reviews.text: apparently spent 27 active minutes and climbed 4 flights at a cost of about a third of battery power except I have been for coffee with friends who can only walk on the flat, v v slowly. I like that it reports calls & texts, be good if it also recognised WhatsApp but battery is ABYSMAL 💣
customer_reviews.author: twooks

customer_reviews.title: Charge 4 performs well but non performance of firmware update is a definite problem
customer_reviews.text: When setting up from new I received a message informing me of a firmware update. I have since tried 3 times to perform this update both on my iPad & iPhone 7 and after going through all steps the update does not happen. I have noted that many other people are also unable to perform this update. The charge 4 performs well on other functions but the non-update is a Definite problem
customer_reviews.author: Jo Pank

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit charge4
customer_reviews.text: Sussed out how to keep battery life longer , I dont do long excercises. Since the very hot weather dont wear to bed,you just have to trial an see what works with notifications
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. Heart rate monitoring is so sketchy. Sleep tracking produces absolute nonsense data. Can’t sync any non-gps activities (eg Gym sessions) to Strava. Half the time the HRM doesn’t work during excercises so picks up only parts of the workout. Where it does pick it up the calories and data on the workout are absolute overestimated BS. Sadly thrown the packaging away otherwise it’s be going back straight away. Just a waste of money - if you want to count steps but something for half the price. The app is poor too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C Lynch

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to work so returned it. I tried all the fixes on the forums and was actually really disappointed to discover so many people have had issues with this watch - something which isn't apparent in the Amazon reviews. It all worked out though. Got myself a beautiful slim Garmin watch and I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: NuMann

customer_reviews.title: Not to shabby
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think this tracker is great I previously have had the charge 2 and versa. I find the charge 4 does more then enough for me. Straight forward setting it up. I haven't used spotify or card payment as i have no need to. I've had this charge 4 for 4 days now I've run, used an elliptical trainer and walked it's just on 57% of battery(I did charge it fully when I got it) Gps was slightly out compared to strava by 0.1 of a mile so no biggy. The thing for me it lacks is clock faces. So hence 4 stars for gps and clock faces
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: GPS does not work
customer_reviews.text: Amazon kindly refunded this Fitbit. Unfortunately my experience is that the GPS is awful on this device. Please avoid this product if you want accurate GPS tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Potter

customer_reviews.title: My opinion on this product
customer_reviews.text: I only use this watch for walking and sleeping as these are the two important things to me. I am in mid seventies and do not cycle or work out just walk on a regular basis. I find that it works for me. The only thing I would say is that the sleep tracking could be better as I know I am awake more than it shows
customer_reviews.author: SUZANNE

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit does not work
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered, charged. Tried to pair up, no display. Not working. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Kernot

customer_reviews.title: Battery life poor when using gps
customer_reviews.text: I brought this so that I could track my routes and therefore choose the best ones to suit. The battery life is awful when using the gps. It’s states up to 5 hours but I was lucky to get 3, which is not good if you want to use it for longer
customer_reviews.author: carolynnjenkins

customer_reviews.title: Faulty device, won't charge.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid at all costs. Faulty device with no troubleshooting help. Bought this as a birthday present and didn't get past the set up stage because the device won't charge. Faulty device, poor design, zero help and feels cheap. Will be sending back for a refund and avoiding fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Kipps

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Sleek, smart and keeps me on track with my fitness regime.
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased a cheaper model prior to my fitbit charge I can safely say this is a good product. Keeps me on track with simplicity. My main activity is swimming and it definitely is waterproof. It looks sleek and does exactly what it says on the box. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley-Anne Hornbogen

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend Fitbit HR rather than this one
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a Fitbit HR which works great for her so I bought this more premium version. The only difference between them is the GPS tracking function which doesn't always work for me. Don't think this additional function worths the additional £70. Besides, I always take the phone with me while running / cycling so I don't really need the built-in GPS.
customer_reviews.author: YT

customer_reviews.title: Nice little fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the tracker to monitor my sleep, but find myself loving all the features, like exercise tracking both walking and cycling, weight tracking (manually inputted into the app) and movement reminders. Well worth the money to me, the App is fully featured but a premium subscription is required if you want advanced insights into your fitness, which is a bit steep at €80 for a year at present
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Everything I need at A great price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a watch that did everything but without the premium price other watches offer and often feel they have to many apps. If you want something for Exercise or to Monitor you and Just get messages this is ideal and works great with our phone without paying a premium price for other watches.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bird

customer_reviews.title: Battery life atrocious using GPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fitbit Charge 4 as it has built in GPS to save carrying a phone but the battery life is atrocious if GPS is used. Product overview says battery lasts up to 7 days but it doesn’t mention that it needs to be charged every other day if used for walking or running. Don’t buy Charge 4 over Charge 3 until the battery problem is solved
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hardy

customer_reviews.title: find it hard to see screen
customer_reviews.text: had the Fitbit charge 2 for over 3 years till it wouldn't charge anymore, so thought about getting the 3 then i saw there was a 4 so i purchased one ,i like it but not as much as the 2 ,i cant read the the screen very well such a shame but otherwise all ok
customer_reviews.author: Treena

customer_reviews.title: Font for stats very small.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a replacement for my old cracked Charge 2 and thought this looked great for the price. It is very easy to set up and has many new features. Unfortunately I couldn’t see any of the stats without my reading glasses as the font is smaller than the Charge 2 with no way of enlarging it. Such a shame, I have now sent it back. Sharp eyed youngsters will love it though.
customer_reviews.author: Vrog

customer_reviews.title: Back to using my old faithful Charge 2
customer_reviews.text: After having a Charge 2 for some years I thought I would treat myself to an upgrade. All though the Charge 4 has a better look & feel, I was disappointed in the accuracy of the Heart Rate Zone. It was showing Cardio Minutes when my heart rate was not even close to the Cardio Zone & this impacted the Zone Minutes recorded. Overall the Charge 4 doesn't bring any thing to the table that I can't get from the Charge 2 to meet my daily requirements. Back to using my old faithful Charge 2 which ticks all the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: iblair

customer_reviews.title: simply doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a problem from the word go - doesnt sync properly, and the battery runs down in a matter of hours. Very frustrating so I am returning. Looking online it seems that there are many dissatisfied customers for the Charge 4
customer_reviews.author: Jjones

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch,I bought because my other watch stopped working.I really enjoy this watch,it helps me with my sleep and daily activity. The only thing I will say is if you are someone who does long running sessions or walks the battery might not last for you.
customer_reviews.author: Róisín

customer_reviews.title: Water proof. Accurate tracking. Great. For motivation
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for fitness taken swimming running bike riding and to gym. I work nights great for. Tracking sleep exercise and heart rate lost 1 stone in a month already with new motivation. Only thing I can fault is plastic strap it comes with is for the tinier wrist. I've brought myself a slightly larger wrist band but otherwise can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: kirsty

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant tracker
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I’ve had Fitbits for about 6 or 7 years, gradually updating to this one. It’s the smallest tracker with built in GPS I’ve ever had and works brilliantly. Also over the years the Fitbit support team have been awesome. I’ve had a couple replaced that failed .. no questions . Outstanding
customer_reviews.author: Iain2012

customer_reviews.title: The strap doesnt fit the device properly
customer_reviews.text: Unlike previous fitbit Charge models, this latest version, I've been very unimpressed by. The straps do not sit flush with the screen which causes a significant gap between the strap and the screen (I tried both straps and they both had the same issue). This means things can catch on it and a lot of dirt is able to build up inside which you wouldn't expect from genuine fitbit straps. This is a known issue on fitbit support forums as well (I wish I had noticed before I purchased it). Overall it doesn't have the same quality the previous models had and was not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anni

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present for my partner, to replace her fitbit charge 3. She really enjoys the added features but is not so keen on the battery life which seems to be worse than the 3. Still lasts way longer than my iWatch which is awful on battery.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: fitbit charge 4 varied problems.
customer_reviews.text: At first it was great then I wasn't getting any notifications to my fitbit. I sent it for repair but I was sent a new one and now this one isn't calculating my sleep properly. My fitbut charge 2 was perfect i expected the charge 4 to be better but for me it's worse.
customer_reviews.author: tracy innocent

customer_reviews.title: Useless for running. GPS won't connect and interface is awful if you are sweaty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a dead Surge for tracking running and it was truly dreadful. The GPS wouldn't connect (just google 'Fitbit Charge 4 won't connect to GPS' to see how much of an issue this is). The display shuts off after a couple of seconds so you have to swipe the screen every time you want to see how you're doing (not easy with sweaty fingers). There is only one button so most things have to be done by swiping, which again is not ideal if you are sweaty during exercise. Returned immediately for a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought that I was upgrading, but no
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a present to upgrade from a Miband4. The app is horrible, and you have to pay a subscription for some of the things that Xiaomi gives you for free. The band looks very nice, but having a price 3 times more expensive than many others, you fell that is extremely overpriced. I sent it back and bought another Miband4, will wait for the 5th and buy it, and even there it will be less than half of the price of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Brand new, not charging
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, would not charge, can't see anything on the screen, only I can feel vibration. I read forums reviews and many have same problem. It seems that if you are lucky to get none faulty fitbit it would work well... I am so disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: mrs katya wheble

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, she says it is very comfortable as it is slim flitting on the wrist, the app is great and there is so much information to be learned, the sleep app is very interesting. Great colour as well. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Does everything it says. Only dissapointment is the fact that after paying for it its then another £79 for premium membership on the app. But i have got free trial for 3 months. Not sure what the app does after that as this is my first fitbit and I WONT be paying more just gor an app.
customer_reviews.author: H Mason

customer_reviews.title: GPS doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The GPS is awful on this device. Stopped working about a week ago and not been able to map a bike ride or run since. Extremely disappointing. Amazon sent me a replacement device and I’m having exactly the same problem. Contacted Fitbit regarding this: no sensible help received. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Annette_G

customer_reviews.title: Gets me and keeps me moving!
customer_reviews.text: Had the charge 2 before. This is definitely an upgrade. Love the colour. Pairs nicely with the app. If you love stats like me, you’ll love breaking down your numbers into trends that you can see easily in the app. Number one thing about it? Motivates me to get off the sofa! This is worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Leena K

customer_reviews.title: Good Clear Display not recommended for Blood pressure monitoring
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit has a good clear display it has a good pedometer, sleep tracker and hear rate monitor. However, I wouldn't recommend the blood pressure monitor as it's not accurate. The battery life is good. The Fitbit and the mobile app will occasionally unbined and it can be difficult to reconnect the Fitbit to the app. To fix the problem, I had to uninstall the app from the goggle play store and reinstall it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Decent upgrade from Charge 2
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded from the charge 2 to the charge 4. Some new features to get to grips with and finally I have a tracker I can swim with. It survived it's first outing in the sea without any problem. The only bugbear is that I've had some inconsistency in respect of GPS tracking....sometimes it will miss the first couple of hundred metres off a run and the distances it gives seem shorter than tracked on my phone or google maps or even the old charge 2? This then messes up your pace and cardio fitness stats a bit! But, this aside, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: to do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: After 5 years my last Fitbit device, got three weeks ago and I am going to replace it with a Garmin. Screen is awful in full light and if your sight is not Perfect, terminate an activity become difficult because of the screen and bad navigation. bye bye Fitbit
customer_reviews.author: Simone G.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I returned this as i was going to get the bigger version, but i was deducted delivery on the return even with prime. I wont bother now
customer_reviews.author: S L

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived and it turned on for 30 seconds and now won’t turn on and is unresponsive despite having been charged for 24h. Very disappointed in this product, and wishing i had read amazon reviews before I had bought it! Very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: + Good accuracy on the heart rate + Like the watch interface. very simply and clear - App not great (e.g. can't see GPS route of runs) - Do not like being forced to link with an account - The GPS is really bad. Doesn't work at all 80% of the time. Not worth it over the Charge 3 - No link to Apple Health Kit
customer_reviews.author: CE MD

customer_reviews.title: GPS Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item after my Fitbit Charge 2 died (after 4 years solid use). Scrolling through the pages on the screen takes a little getting used to as there is no longer a push button. Having GPS included is fantastic. No more having to carry my phone with me to track/map my route when out for a run. Brilliant. The GPS drains the battery somewhat but I turn the GPS off when I am not running which conserves the battery usage. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Charge 2
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know why ppl are so hard on this product. It offer what it said it would offer. Great tracking and really accurate tracking of my steps (even when pushing the push chair). The only negatives I’d have would be the cost (£150 with a fancy strap) and the limited number of banks using the pay service on the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathew D. Howells

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to make the battery last, turn off the GPS, unfortunately, this is what I bought it for so I can track progress on map, however, it makes the battery run out in a day. The app could be a lot more intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: My product was delivered on 7th August, there was a problem with the product as it would not charge properly, after spending in excess of 30 minutes on the phone I was told the problem was with the charger and a new one would be sent out to me, it is now 6th September and I am still waiting at this stage I am not entirely sure the problem is with with the charger it could be the Fitbit that is the problem! I have emailed again asking where my replacement is but not has any response! Not very impressed at all with the after sales service
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M J Fillery

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well I use it for walking and cycling, battery life is good but when using the excercise mode and gps the battery life is reduced and may not be enough on a long cycle ride. But putting these things aside it is very good piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: J Simpson

product_meta.title: Fitbit Charge 4 Fitness and Activity Tracker with Built-in GPS, Heart Rate, Sleep & Swim Tracking, Black/Black, One Size (S &L Bands Included)
product_meta.description: Color:Black/Black| Edition:RegularWith Fitbit Charge 4, there’s no limit to how far you can go. This sleek, swimproof tracker is packed with features that help you know your workouts and your body better—like built-in GPS, Active Zone Minutes, new exercise modes and sleep tracking. Plus, with Fitbit Pay and up to 7-days of battery life, you get more convenience on the go and more inspiration to reach your fitness goals.
feature_bullets: Use built-in GPS to see your pace and distance on screen during outdoor runs, rides, hikes and more and see a workout intensity map in the app that shows your heart rate changes along your route
With Active Zone Minutes, feel a buzz when you reach your target heart rate zones during exercise, and celebrate when you earn extra minutes outside of exercise

Get a 90-day free trial of the Fitbit Premium to help you stay active, sleep well and manage stress. Unlock it all in the Fitbit app. (The valid payment method required. Cancel before free trial ends to avoid subscription fees. Offer valid for new Premium users only)
Use 24/7 heart rate to track resting heart rate & better measure calorie burn
Play your favorite songs and playlists with Spotify app controls on your wrist. Also make secure purchases with Fitbit Pay and get called, text and smartphone app notifications.
Track workouts in real-time with 20+ goal-based exercise modes. It’s also swimproof and water resistant to 50M, so you can track swims, we're in the shower and more
Multi-day battery lasts up to 7 days and up to 5 hours when using built-in GPS (varies with use & other factors)
Track sleep stages & review your in-app Sleep Score for an easy way to see how well you slept.
